thread.title: Arsenal stars give the Denver Nuggets a tour of the Emirates ahead of upcoming NBA Global Games
thread.title_full: Arsenal stars give the Denver Nuggets a tour of the Emirates ahead of upcoming NBA Global Games

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Arsenal stars give the Denver Nuggets a tour of the Emirates ahead of upcoming NBA Global Games
text:
Sport Arsenal stars give the Denver Nuggets a tour of the Emirates ahead of upcoming NBA Global Games The Nuggets take on the Indiana Pacers in London later this month and took a break from practice to head to north London where they were given a tour by Per Mertesacker, Hector Bellerin and Rob Holding Share Denver are in London for the upcoming Global Games (Photo: NBAE via Getty Images) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Arsenal's players have given the Denver Nuggets a tour of the Emirates ahead of the NBA Global Games. 
The Nuggets take on the Indiana Pacers in London later this month and took a break from practice to head north of the capital. 
Each member of the roster turned out at the Emirates and was given their very own signed Gunners shirt. 
Hector Bellerin , Per Mertesacker and Rob Holding were on hand to give the basketball stars a guided tour of the changing rooms and pitch. Kenneth Faried talks with Per Mertesacker (Photo: NBAE via Getty Images) The duo show off their shirts (Photo: NBAE via Getty Images) The Nuggets and the Gunners line up together (Photo: NBAE via Getty Images) 
Juan Hernangomez said: "It was great to visit Arsenal – I play with them a lot on FIFA. 
"We have a great Spanish player, Santi Cazorla, who I like a lot and it was great to meet another Spaniard Hector Bellerin of course. I also admire Petr Cech – he’s one of my favourite players.” Emmanual Mudiay with his No.0 shirt (Photo: NBAE via Getty Images) Mudiay poses for a selfie at the Emirates (Photo: NBAE via Getty Images) The two sets of players on the pitch (Photo: NBAE via Getty Images) 
Emmaniel Mudiay cherished the experience - but admits he was more delighted with his momento. 
"It was great to find out more about the history of Arsenal, what they’re about but I was most excited about getting a jersey," he added. 
Denver take on Indiana at The O2 on Thursday evening. Like us on Facebook
